content: Both card.source.topic, and card.overrideReasons[i] are objects which have properties code, system, and display. So should these be two different types Topic, and OverrideReason, or should we start defining datatypes in CDS Hooks? if we make a Coding, that can be the type for both card.source.topic, and card.overrideReasons[i]. And we can also make feedback[i].overrideReason contain a Coding object and a string userComment?
And that also leads to the question, should we reuse FHIR Coding type for this?
